title: American_Top_40_1978_September_23rd
description:
A storm came through and I lost both my computers, but I was able to record one "extra" for this 1978 show. When this September 23rd show was broadcast, AT40 only had one more three-hour show to release and then they went to a four-hour format. All my old AT40 shows survived on an external hard drive. Some of those are shows from 1978 and 1979 where the re-broadcasting stations only played the last three hours of a four hour show. Each one is like a smile with a missing tooth. As soon as I get a new desk top, I'll get back to torrenting them, however they were recorded. Now, on with the countdown!


"Hello again, and welcome to American Top 40. I'm Casey Kasem and this is our weekly countdown of the forty hottest records in the country."


In this broadcast:

A listener writes, "When Chuck Mangione was on the chart recently with an instrumental hit, it made me wonder which recording act in the rock era placed the most instrumentals in the top 40." The act that did it put more than two dozen hits in the hot 100 and 15 in the top 40.

There is a group in the countdown who once had a job in a night-club where the owner wouldn't let them play the most popular song they'd ever had. That song is in this countdown.

Casey answers the question, "What has been the biggest song of the rock era with a man's name in the title?"

Casey tells us about a session musician who has 150 gold records to his name, more than Elvis or The Beatles.
